comments:
Hi,
with version 3.0M5 we are getting this error msg on the CVS server.

cvspserver/tcp server failing (looping), service terminated

Here are a couple of link where the problem is described

http://mail.gnu.org/archive/html/info-cvs/2001-04/msg00803.html
http://www.geocrawler.com/archives/3/382/1999/4/0/2094657/

This appears even when only one developer is working.
I suspect it's related to the synchronize view but I'm not sure.

We changed the server max value from 40 to 100 and this "solved" the problem.

Bye

Lorenzo

We've taken great pains to minimize the number of server connections needed 
for syncing but I can easily conceive of the possibility of exceeding 40 
connections in a minutes for some workspace setups. We should add this to the 
FAQ and also consider whether we should try to limit the number of connections 
made in a minute.

Having said that, I would like to make sure that what is happening is a factor 
of how your workspace is set up and not excesive connections during a sync.
Is it an explicit operation (refesh, update, etc.) that is causing the problem 
or is it the background refresh? Can you tell us a bit about your setup? For 
example, how many projects does a developer typically have in their workspace? 
Are they all on the same server? Are they large or small? What connetion 
method are they using (pserver, extssh or ext)?

Today we hit the limit again (100 con, 1 developer).
I suppose the problem is more with background refresh, but I've not (yet) done
much testing. After setting the limit to 100 I've done 30/40 explicit refresh in
the synchronize view and nothing happened.
About your questions.
In the workspace there are 5/15 projects (large and small ones), usually 1/2 open.
We have only one project on this cvs server. On the server there is only this
one module. I'm quite sure nobody else uses this server.
We have watch/edit enabled. We have Quickdiff enabled on cvs.
Refresh runs in background, but the refresh is not scheduled to run automatically.
Connection is with pserver. On the server there are about 500 file, sources and
libs for about 4/5 mb.
I made a quick check for cvs connections and found that are all very short,
open-do-close. Is this the expected behavior?

I noticed, from progress view, that every time a file is saved a cvs refresh is
done.

sorry attached log to wrong bug...   meant for previous bug but after commit in 
bugzilla for some reason i ended up on this bug report instead of the previous.

The CVS refresh you see is just a refresh of the local CVS information cache 
and does not indicate a round trip to the server.

My preliminary investigation revealed that:

1) CVS Quickdiff is well behaved in tt it only fetches the contents for a 
single file once and caches it for future use.

2) Watch/Edit is well behaved if clients (i.e. tool plugins such as JDT) call 
validateEdit. However, it is poorly behaved with tools that do not call 
validateEdit since it then relies on the validateSave mechanism which is 
called for a single file. The example I saw where this was a problem was 
deleting several folders from a projects. A connection was made for each file 
being deleted. Each connection is quick so could easily flood a server in 
short amount of time.

The second issue is actually quite difficult to address. If you are using 
Eclipse with Watch/Edit, you may need to increase your server connection value 
to somehting like 1000 and see if that helps.

We will continue to investigate this for M6 but, as I said, point 2 will take 
a while to address (i.e. will not be addressed in M6).
Haven't seen this lately. Pleasse reopn if this is still a problem for you.
